From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Italian attaccare.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [ə.təˈka]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [a.taˈkaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

atacar (first-person singular present ataco, first-person singular preterite ataquí, past participle atacat)

  1. to attack, to strike
  2. to attach, to sew on
  3. to pack, to fill

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of atacar (first conjugation, c-qu alternation)

gerund atacant
past participle masculine feminine
singular atacat atacada
plural atacats atacades

preterite ataquí atacares atacà atacàrem atacàreu atacaren
conditional atacaria atacaries atacaria atacaríem atacaríeu atacarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella

affirmative — ataca ataqui ataquem ataqueu ataquin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • atac
  • atacador
  • atacant

Further reading

[edit]
  • “atacar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “atacar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “atacar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “atacar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology 1

[edit]

From Italian attaccare (“to join; to attack”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ataˈkaɾ]

Verb

[edit]

atacar (first-person singular present ataco, first-person singular preterite ataquei, past participle atacado)

  1. to attack
  2. (of a disease) to strike

Etymology 2

[edit]

From a- +‎ taco +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ataˈkaɾ]

Verb

[edit]

atacar (first-person singular present ataco, first-person singular preterite ataquei, past participle atacado)

  1. to pack; to clog
    • 1807, anonymous author, Primeiro diálogo dos esterqueiros:
      en fin caixas, é caixòs,
      atacados de papeles
      é outras moitas endromenas
      que non sei como lle chaman.
      so, boxes and drawers
      packed with papers
      and many other thingies
      whose name I don't know
  2. (pronominal) to get stuck
  3. (pronominal) to get obstructed

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Italian attaccare.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ataˈka]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

atacar

  1. to attack

Derived terms

[edit]
  • atac

Portuguese

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • attacar (obsolete)

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Italian attaccare (“to join; to attack”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.taˈka(ʁ)/ [a.taˈka(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.taˈka(ʁ)/ [a.taˈka(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /a.taˈka(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /a.taˈka(ʁ)/ [a.taˈka(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /a.taˈka(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.tɐˈkaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.tɐˈkaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.tɐˈka.ɾi/

  • Audio (Portugal (Porto)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: a‧ta‧car

Verb

[edit]

atacar (first-person singular present ataco, first-person singular preterite ataquei, past participle atacado)

  1. to attack (to apply violent force)
    Synonyms: agredir, assaltar, investir
    Fui atacado por um cão.
    I was attacked by a dog.
  2. to attack (to aggressively challenge a person or idea)
    Synonyms: criticar, reprovar
    Este artigo ataca a nova teoria.
    This article attacks the new theory.
  3. to attack (to deal with something in a direct way)
    O prefeito prometeu atacar a pobreza.
    The mayor promised to attack poverty.
  4. (sports) to attempt to score
    Perdendo no final do jogo, até a zaga teve que atacar.
    Losing at the end of the match, even the defence had to attack.
  5. (of a disease) to strike
    A gripe me ataca todo verão.
    I am stricken by a cold every summer.
  6. to eat voraciously
    A pizza cheirava tão bem que ataquei a fatia.
    The pizza smelled so good that I attacked the slice.

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of atacar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person

atacando
Past participle

Feminine atacada atacadas
Indicative
Present ataco atacas ataca atacamos atacais atacam
Imperfect atacava atacavas atacava atacávamos atacáveis atacavam
Preterite ataquei atacaste atacou atacamos1, atacámos2 atacastes atacaram
Pluperfect atacara atacaras atacara atacáramos atacáreis atacaram
Future atacarei atacarás atacará atacaremos atacareis atacarão
Conditional atacaria atacarias atacaria atacaríamos atacaríeis atacariam
Subjunctive
Present ataque ataques ataque ataquemos ataqueis ataquem
Imperfect atacasse atacasses atacasse atacássemos atacásseis atacassem
Future atacar atacares atacar atacarmos atacardes atacarem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • atacado
  • atacador
  • atacante
  • atacável
  • ataque

Further reading

[edit]
  • “atacar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Italian attaccare.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ataˈkaɾ/ [a.t̪aˈkaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧ta‧car

Verb

[edit]

atacar (first-person singular present ataco, first-person singular preterite ataqué, past participle atacado)

  1. (transitive, intransitive) to attack, to come at
  2. (transitive, intransitive) to engage (enter into conflicted with)
  3. (transitive) to assail

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of atacar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive atacar
gerund atacando
past participle masculine feminine
singular atacado atacada
plural atacados atacadas
singular plural

imperfect

imperative — tú
vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros

affirmative atacatú
atacávos 		ataque ataquemos atacad ataquen
negative no ataques no ataque no ataquemos no ataquéis no ataquen

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
